title: Inditex 1st Half Net Profit Rose; Sees FY19 LFL Sales Growth
text:
By Olivia Bugault

Spain's Inditex (ITX.MC) said Wednesday that net profit in the first half grew, and that the company expects like-for-like sales to rise by a mid-single digit in its full-year 2019.

The company, which owns the Zara chain of stores, said net profit for the period was 1.55 billion euros ($1.71 billion), compared with EUR1.41 billion a year earlier.

Sales rose 7% to EUR12.82 billion, helped by growth in all brands and regions, the company said. On a like-for-like basis, sales grew 5%.

Gross margin for the first half was 56.8%, compared with 56.7% the year previous.

The company said store and online sales rose 8% between Aug. 1 and Sept. 8 in local currencies. and estimates that LFL sales will grow by 4% to 6% in its full-year 2019.
